Package Classes

Class AppointmentDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • Classes.AppointmentDB
  • public class AppointmentDB
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to house the SELECT statements for any appointment queries.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description

    • Method Detail

      • getCustomersAppointmentList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getCustomersAppointmentList​(int customerID)
        This static method takes a customer id. It then puts all of that customerID's appointments in the customer appointments array list. This array list is used to check against overlapping appointments for the customer.
        Parameters:
        customerID - the integer handed into the method to get associated appointments for that customer
        Returns:
        an observable array list is returned

      • getEveryAppointmentList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getEveryAppointmentList()
        This static method takes no parameters. It pulls all the appointments and puts them in the all appointments array list. This will be used to fill a tableview for displaying.
        Returns:
        an observable array list is returned

      • getAppointmentType

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> getAppointmentType()
        This static method takes no parameters. It pulls distinct type names from all the appointments and puts them in one list.
        Returns:
        an observable array list is returned

      • checkForOverlappingAppointments

        public static boolean checkForOverlappingAppointments​(java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                                      java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                                                      int appID)
        This static boolean performs checks for outside business hours and for customer overlapping appointments. If it changes flips to false at any point, it will trigger a message to the user explaining why it accept the start and end date-time
        Parameters:
        start - the start time passed into the method
        end - the end time passed into the method
        appID - the app id passed into the method
        Returns:
        a true or false value is returned
